item.title: 'If I had 15 attackers I'd be happy to have Salah back'
item.description: Mohamed Salah returns to Liverpool next week with boss Arne Slot saying he would be pleased to have the forward back even if he had "15 attackers".

item.title: Players need social skills for World Cup - Tuchel
item.description: England manager Thomas Tuchel says players will need the right "social skills" and personality to make his World Cup squad.

item.title: Roma sign forward Malen from Aston Villa
item.description: Netherlands forward Donyell Malen joins Roma from Aston Villa after just one year with the Premier League side.

item.title: Carrick 'right choice at this moment' - Rooney
item.description: Wayne Rooney says caretaker head coach Michael Carrick is the "right choice at this moment in time" to "steady the ship" at Manchester United.

item.title: From Fiji to Latvia - are cross-border leagues the future?
item.description: The OFC Professional League kicks off this week and a Baltic League has been proposed, so is there a future for cross-border football competitions?

item.title: Should you keep or sell Semenyo? FPL talking point
item.description: Antoine Semenyo has made a fantastic start to his career at Manchester City with two goals in as many games - so should he stay in your FPL team?

item.title: Top-flight match, Nygren & Leven in focus in Scottish Cup
item.description: A tasty top-flight tie and two of Sunday's main operatives are in focus in the fourth round of the Scottish Cup.

item.title: Rejections, depression & promise to his mum - Thiago's route to top
item.description: Igor Thiago's route to the Premier League has been far from straightforward - BBC Sport charts the rise of Brentford's record-breaking Brazilian striker.

item.title: Five things in the EFL: Dugout debuts and top tussles
item.description: BBC Sport outlines the games to keep an eye on across the EFL this weekend.

item.title: Can you name every Women's FA Cup winner?
item.description: There have been 55 finals since the Women's FA Cup began in 1970-71. How many winners can you name? Good luck!

item.title: Aston Villa eyeing Abraham return - Friday's gossip
item.description: Tammy Abraham could reunite with Aston Villa, Manchester United hope to sign Carlos Baleba in the summer, and Jean-Philippe Mateta is a target for Juventus.

item.title: Caretaker boss Carrick's best Man Utd moments
item.description: With Michael Carrick returning to Manchester United as caretaker manager, BBC Sport takes a look back at some of his best moments for the club as a player in the Premier League.

item.title: 'He knows what he wants' - Chalobah on new manager Rosenior
item.description: Chelsea defender Trevoh Chalobah says new manager Liam Rosenior has asked the squad to "trust in themselves" and to "rely on each other" following his appointment at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: WSL players make confessions including Toone, Shaw and Kelly
item.description: The best moments from BBC Sport’s Confession Cam featuring WSL stars Khadija Shaw, Ella Toone, Chloe Kelly and more.

item.title: Watch trailer for Mo Salah: Never Give Up
item.description: Watch the trailer for BBC documentary Mo Salah: Never Give Up.

item.title: Rodri and Cisse star in best goals of the FA Cup third round
item.description: Watch the best goals from across the FA Cup third-round weekend, including Isaac Buckley-Ricketts' stunner for Macclesfield FC.

item.title: Managers' authority is being eroded - Southgate
item.description: Football managers' authority is being steadily eroded, Sir Gareth Southgate says, but the switch to head coaching still brings a "significant melting pot of problems and pressure".

item.title: When is the Conference League play-off draw and who is involved?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks at who Crystal Palace could face in the Conference League play-off draw and explains how the draw works.

item.title: After agony in Morocco, what's next for Salah with club and country?
item.description: What does Mohamed Salah's future hold for Liverpool and Egypt after their Afcon disappointment?

item.title: Lennon on 'huge loss' of father & meeting Hibs in cup
item.description: Neil Lennon reflects on the recent loss of his father before Dunfermline Athletic's Scottish Cup meeting with Hibernian.

item.title: Robertson keen to stay at Liverpool but 'wants to play football'
item.description: Liverpool's Andy Robertson on contract talks, a "stressful summer" and why he "wants to play" rather than sit on the bench.

item.title: Late goals add shine as Liverpool beat spirited Barnsley in FA Cup
item.description: Liverpool score two late goals to add shine to their FA Cup third round victory over spirited League One side Barnsley at Anfield.

item.title: Carrick would bring spirit of Man Utd back - Rooney
item.description: Wayne Rooney discusses Michael Carrick’s potential role as Manchester United caretaker and whether he’d join the coaching staff.

item.title: Cascarino denied WSL debut because of earring
item.description: West Ham's new signing Estelle Cascarino was denied a chance to make her Women's Super League debut because of an earring.

item.title: Rooney & Heathcote reflect on Macclesfield's 'incredible' cup win
item.description: Macclesfield manager John Rooney and defender Sam Heathcote talk to BBC Breakfast about their stunning FA Cup upset over holders Crystal Palace.

item.title: Welbeck scores as Brighton knock Man Utd out of FA Cup
item.description: Striker Danny Welbeck helps Brighton dump his former club Manchester United out of the FA Cup at Old Trafford.

item.title: What does xG predict for the rest of the season?
item.description: With more than half the season gone, we have enough stats to get a good idea of how well Premier League teams have been playing and therefore how things are likely to unfold in the months ahead.

item.title: Richarlison out for seven weeks with hamstring injury
item.description: Tottenham forward Richarlison is ruled out for up to seven weeks with a hamstring injury.

item.title: Paqueta could move but be loaned back to West Ham
item.description: Flamengo are exploring the possibility of loaning Lucas Paqueta back to West Ham as they try to sign the Brazil international this month.

item.title: 'Cut me a little slack' - O'Neill calls for patience on Celtic transfers
item.description: The Celtic manager Martin O'Neill says "cut me a little bit of slack" as the club work on bringing in new faces this month.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Offside or not? Man City, Arsenal and VAR inconsistencies
item.description: Manchester City had their goal disallowed, while Arsenal's was allowed to stand. But the VAR should not look to be consistent with a previous bad decision.

item.title: Watch every angle of Gordon's save of the season contender
item.description: Watch Hearts goalkeeper Craig Gordon's impressive late save in his side's 1-0 win at Dundee from different angles.

item.title: Arsenal beat Portsmouth thanks to Martinelli hat-trick
item.description: Gabriel Martinelli scores the first hat-trick of his senior career as an Arsenal side showing 10 changes come from a goal down to beat Championship side Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

item.title: Leeds avoid upset with second-half comeback against Derby
item.description: James Justin scored his first goal for Leeds United since joining from Leicester City in the summer, in a second-half comeback after Derby County took the lead thanks to a Ben Brereton Diaz strike.

item.title: Castellanos scores in extra time as West Ham edge past QPR
item.description: Valentin 'Taty' Castellanos scores his first goal for West Ham United as they beat Queens Park Rangers in extra time and progress to the fourth round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Watch best of Saturday's weather-affected SPFL action
item.description: Watch the best of the action from Saturday's weather-affected Scottish Championship, League 1 and League 2 programme.

item.title: Semenyo, Wirtz and two Black Cats - FPL team of the week
item.description: This gameweek's FPL team of the week is stacked with Liverpool and Manchester City attacking assets, with Antoine Semenyo picked after an explosive start to life at Etihad Stadium.

item.title: No VAR error over Wirtz 'offside' goal, panel says
item.description: The VAR was correct to intervene and give Florian Wirtz's goal at Fulham despite the Liverpool player appearing to be offside, a panel says.

item.title: Aberdeen manager shortlist 'in a few more days'
item.description: Aberdeen will be closer to a managerial shortlist "in a few more days", says sporting director Lutz Pfannenstiel.

item.title: Fernandes not seeking to leave Man Utd in January
item.description: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes is not planning to seek a move away from the club this month.

item.title: Wrexham's O'Connor fined for FA betting offences
item.description: Wrexham's Tom O'Connor - currently on loan at Peterborough United - has been fined for breaches of the Football Association's betting rules.

item.title: 'I've surprised myself' - Ballard on Premier League step-up
item.description: Sunderland defender Daniel Ballard admits he had "doubts" that he would be able to step up to the Premier League, but says he has been "surprised" by his and the Black Cats' start to life back in the top flight.

item.title: Eto'o handed ban and fine for misconduct at Afcon
item.description: Former Cameroon star Samuel Eto'o is handed a four-match ban and fined $20,000 after being found guilty of misconduct by the Confederation of African Football.

item.title: Bayern's record-breaking Bundesliga season in numbers
item.description: BBC Sport examines the stunning numbers behind Bayern Munich's record-breaking start to the Bundesliga season - and what records they could topple.

item.title: Is Wenger's daylight idea the solution to fix offside?
item.description: Is the offside law about to change to Arsene Wenger's daylight idea? And should football make that change just because of VAR?

item.title: Why has no English boss won Premier League - and who could be first?
item.description: Why has an English manager not won the Premier League? Chief football writer Phil McNulty explores who could make history.

item.title: Trump's foreign policy and what it might mean for the World Cup
item.description: As a group of cross-party MPs calls on Fifa to consider expelling the USA from the World Cup, BBC Sport analyses what Donald Trump’s foreign policy means for the tournament.

item.title: VAR errors increase: Each of the 13 mistakes so far this season
item.description: The Premier League's KMI Panel makes judgements on every key decisions. Here's what they say the VAR has got wrong.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: Why is there no VAR in the FA Cup third and fourth round?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why VAR is not in use in the third and fourth rounds of the FA Cup.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Is the new manager bounce real or a myth?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains whether the new manager bounce is real, or just a myth

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: When does the January transfer window open and close?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team look at when the 2026 January transfer window opens.

item.title: Scotland's Clarke open to new players but loyal to 'core group'
item.description: Steve Clarke is open to potential new faces in his Scotland squad but hints his player pool for the World Cup will be along familiar lines.

item.title: 'Rangers' Tavernier wanted by Panathinaikos' - gossip
item.description: Rangers captain James Tavernier is reportedly wanted by Panathinaikos as Celtic are said to have enquired about West Ham United's Callum Wilson and Aberdeen are linked with a number of moves.

item.title: Rangers' Rohl predicts final day title showdown
item.description: Rangers manager Danny Rohl believes the Scottish Premiership title race could go to a dramatic three-team shootout on the final day of the season.

item.title: Cancelo returns to Barcelona on loan
item.description: Barcelona announce the signing of former Manchester City defender Joao Cancelo on loan until the end of the season.

item.title: Spurs sporting director Paratici to join Fiorentina
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur sporting director Fabio Paratici will leave Spurs at the end of the January transfer window to join Serie A side Fiorentina.

item.title: Manager Alonso leaves Real Madrid as Arbeloa takes charge
item.description: Xabi Alonso leaves his position as Real Madrid manager after less than eight months in charge as former Liverpool team-mate Alvaro Arbeloa is appointed as replacement.

item.title: Benfica players sleep at training ground after loss
item.description: Jose Mourinho takes his players to stay at Benfica's training ground after they lose against Braga in the League Cup semi-final.

item.title: Ebnoutalib's rapid rise from fourth tier to potential star
item.description: Younes Ebnoutalib was playing in Germany's fourth tier a year ago - now he hopes to be the latest in a line of star forwards at Eintracht Frankfurt.

item.title: Leicester City sign Williams from Man Utd
item.description: Leicester City have signed forward Rachel Williams from Manchester United on a one-and-a-half-year deal, with a club option to extend for a year.

item.title: Morocco set for derby with Algeria in Wafcon 2026 group
item.description: Morocco are handed a North African derby with Algeria and holders Nigeria will face Zambia in the group stage at the 2026 Women's Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Manchester City sign USA midfielder Coffey
item.description: Manchester City have signed United States midfielder Sam Coffey from Portland Thorns on a three-and-a-half-year contract.

item.title: West Ham defender Tysiak joins Union Berlin
item.description: West Ham defender Amber Tysiak has joined German side Union Berlin.

item.title: Agyemang returns to Arsenal for ACL recovery
item.description: England striker Michelle Agyemang returns to Arsenal to recover from injury following a loan spell at Brighton & Hove Albion.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
